DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study help determine best treatment plan woman PCOS overweight obese experience significant symptom depression anxiety . Specifically , investigator attempt see difference cognitive behavioral therapy combination nutritional counseling improve mood symptom , response stress , risk factor heart disease compare nutrition counsel alone . The investigator hypothesize combine treatment Cognitive Behavioral Therapy ( CBT ) nutritional counseling beneficial .
DOC.brief_title: Mood Nutrition Interventions Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: This study assess impact treatment mood associate anxiety disorder conjunction nutritional/exercise counsel overweight/obese woman PCOS cardiometabolic risk . The investigator hypothesize woman PCOS great benefit dual intervention ( psychological nutritional/exercise counseling ) change depressive symptom cardiometabolic risk reduction compare nutritional/exercise counsel alone . In addition , investigator hypothesize psychological counseling may improve cardiometabolic risk decrease stress response stress associate marker inflammation .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis Polycystic Ovary Syndrome ( PCOS ) Overweight obese ( BMI 2750 ) Screen positive symptom depression Smoking 5 cigarette per day Severe depression/anxiety warrant immediate treatment Actively participate weight loss program Taking medication control cholesterol diabetes On hormonal therapy ( must discontinue eligible ) Pregnancy plan become pregnant study period Inability commute Philadelphia weekly study session
